Paragraph.Text: “Homeland” is a one-hour TV drama divided into five Acts. Use the New Act element just before your first Scene Heading.
If there is a SUPER (text on the screen often denoting time/date/location), use the Legend element so it formats like this:
legend: khadimiyah military prison, baghdad - april 2009
The Legend should appear after the Action/Description and before the next Scene Heading. The End of Act element is used to conclude each act.
If someone speaks in another language, it’s denoted in the Parenthetical element like this:
After adding the End of Act element on page 1, a page break will be automatically inserted, moving your next act to a new page.
The rest of the script should be formatted like a normal screenplay. With your Action/Description beats in separate paragraphs.
When you’re last act is complete, you can fade out and use the End of Act element to finish.
